actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend the Railroad Retirement Act of 1937 to provide that an individual shall be considered to have completed the minimum service required to qualify for a retirement annuity under the provisions of that act if he or she had at any time in the past completed the minimum service required to qualify for a retirement annuity under the corresponding provisions of law in effect at that time.

summary.text: Provides under the Railroad Retirement Act of 1937, that an individual shall be considered to have completed the minimum service required to qualify for a retirement annuity under the provisions of that Act if he or she had at any time in the past completed the minimum service required to qualify for a retirement annuity under the corresponding provisions of law in effect at that time.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Railroad Retirement Act of 1937 to provide that an individual shall be considered to have completed the minimum service required to qualify for a retirement annuity under the provisions of that act if he or she had at any time in the past completed the minimum service required to qualify for a retirement annuity under the corresponding provisions of law in effect at that time.
